title: Ticket #5802: Job Router's JOB_FINALIZE hook has wrong name
description:
The hook in the Job Router that's invoked when the routed job completes has different names in the code and the manual. In the code, it's JOB_EXIT. In the manual, it's JOB_FINALIZE. The behavior in the manual appears to be accurate. JOB_EXIT is also a starter hook, though the behavior is different between the two versions.

We will make JOB_FINALIZE the official name of the hook. That will minimize confusion about two hooks with the same name but different interfaces.

If JOB_FINALIZE isn't set in the config file, we'll look for JOB_EXIT as a fallback, in case any users are relying on the undocumented name from previous versions. This fallback should be removed in a future release.
